title: Inside the '90s themed holiday rental that's about to give you major nostalgia
text:
Get the biggest Weekly Travel stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

The bedroom of any '90s child's dreams has just been brought to life and we're getting a serious dose of nostalgia.

Hotels.com has just unveiled a brand new Lisa Frank Flat inspired by the '90s pop culture icon, and it's sure to send any '90s kid into meltdown.

We're talking neon murals, a light-up canopy bed, a desk with a stationery kit we could only have dreamed of in school, a bathroom that's been transformed into an 'underwater dolphin fantasy world' (complete with mermaids of course) neon lights, metallic pink lamps, four poster bed, sequins, gel pens...

As well as the eye-catching bedroom there's a plush living area with technicolour rainbow inspired kitten and heart designs, and of course, a few unicorns.

Even the kitchen looks like something from the set of our favourite '90s TV shows with bold colours, and a minibar stocked with all the throwback snacks you can dream of (which are free fr guests).

(Image: Hotels.com)

Of course all that excitement can get a bit much, so slip into one of the multi-coloured bath robes, slippers and sleep masks for total relaxation - and the limited-edition items are yours for the taking.

(Image: Hotels.com)

The Lisa Frank Flat is a very real holiday rental and bookings are due to open this week. However, there's a slight hiccup for Brits, as the spacious Barsala penthouse is located in Los Angeles.

(Image: Hotels.com)

Not exactly ideal for a short trip.

Of course if you have a holiday booked or were thinking of a trip anyway, it's worth leaving space on the itinerary.

Oh, and there are return flights to LA from £321pp on Skyscanner if you really are dedicated to a trip down memory lane.

(Image: Hotels.com)

The Lisa Frank Flat will be open for bookings from Friday 11th October on the Hotels.com listing here until Sunday 27th October. Stays will be on offer for the same window of dates.

Prices start from $199 a night (approx £163) and the flat can be booked for multiple nights.

(Image: Hotels.com)

Adam Jay, President of Hotels.com, said: "We wanted to design a room that celebrates all things ‘90s, and nothing screams childhood nostalgia more these iconic designs.

"Hotels.com is thrilled to bring this dream room to life and reward travelers with a blast from their past."
description: Get ready for a trip down memory lane in this bright and colourful flat that's a glorious tribute to all things 90s
